name: Michio Honda
content: Michio Honda Skip to Main Menu I am a Reader (equivalent to Associate Professor in the US) in the School of Informatics at the University of Edinburgh. My research interest is computer networks, operating systems and security. My best known work is identifying TCP extensibility against middlebox interference (IMC'11) and building the first TCP/IP network stack for persistent memory (NSDI'18). Current projects include secure transport protocol design for the cloud, efficient yet flexible load balancing, and host networking and storage stack co-design. I am a recipient of IRTF Applied Networking Research Prize, Meta Research Award and Google Research Scholar Award.
